page.title: 06Woodland in Woodhalls
page.content: The area is fortunate in having a lot of woodland.The hedgebanks,many of them 8ft.high,are tightly packed with a variety of species:hazel,holly,will- ow,ivy,oak,ash and hawthorn.Along the banks mature English oaks have been allowed to grow up.Trees also follow the water courses.There are a large number of woods and copses, particularly to the north of the area and also on part of the Broomford Manor estate at Jacobstowe.The woods are privately owned, not managed commercially,but for household purposes.The woods are predominantly deciduous woodlands, mainly oak but also including common ash, silver birch, willow, alder, beech, horse - chestnut and sycamore.Due to Dutch Elm disease the English elm has sadly gone.There are some coniferous plantations at Jacobstowe.
